name: underfed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not having had enough food to eat: Weak, underfed patients risk undoing the good medical work carried out on their behalf. A lot of the elephants are underfed and overworked, and become very thin. See also
malnourished
More examplesFewer examplesIn some countries experiencing obesity problems, malnutrition also exists; whether underfed or overfed, people aren't getting the nutrients and vitamins that lead to proper development. Interestingly, scientists learned that underfed rodents lived up to 40% longer than their well-fed counterparts.He said that of 300 million underfed children in the world, 130 million, most of them girls, do not go to school.The children are much smaller than they should be for their age. A child that you think is a healthy two-year-old is probably a very underfed four-year old.
